main_definition: Full of activity or engagement; not free to do other things.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Involved with numerous tasks or activities simultaneously.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was too busy preparing for the conference to answer my call.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Occupied, having no spare time due to commitments or engagements.
meanings_and_examples.example: I can't join you for dinner; I have a really busy schedule tonight.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Focused on an activity that requires continuous effort and attention.
meanings_and_examples.example: The gardener was very busy planting new flowers in the garden.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having a full schedule or workload, often with little time for rest or relaxation.
meanings_and_examples.example: He's always busy; he barely has any time to unwind after work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Full of bustle and noise due to activity, as in a city or marketplace.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the holiday season, the town square is usually very busy with shoppers.
